definitions.definition: To make (something) smaller or as small as possible; shrink ; reduce .
examples: We have to minimize the budget.

definitions.definition: To relegate or assign (something) to a less insignificant status; diminish .
examples: The insurance adjuster tried to minimize the extent of the damage to lessen the company's exposure to liability.

definitions.definition: To remove (a window ) from the main display area, collapsing it to an icon or caption .
examples: I didn't close anything, but I minimized all the windows so I could see the desktop.

definitions.definition: To treat (someone) in a slighting manner.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To make (something) smaller or as small as possible; shrink ; reduce .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To relegate or assign (something) to a less insignificant status; diminish .
( computing , transitive , graphical user interface ) To remove (a window ) from the main display area, collapsing it to an icon or caption .
( transitive ) To treat (someone) in a slighting manner.
